issue.title: [C++] Decide if typed Tensor subclasses are worthwhile
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-860](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-860). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
See discussion in https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/560. Since this is primarily a data container (only `arrow::Tensor` being used in Python, for example), and the subclasses are quite a bit of work to wrap, it's unclear whether they are of high value to maintain.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-860?focusedCommentId=15976252) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Issue resolved by pull request 571
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/571>
